BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement ‚Äì Item Price Element

Item price element of a solution order item can be created by passing the price element in the _PriceElement association at the item while creating a solution order using deep insert.

The item price element entity can also be created using the association _ PriceElement of the BusinessSolutionOrderItem entity.

 

Create an item price element for an existing solution order item

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/10/_PriceElement

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "ConditionType": "DRV1",
  "ConditionRateValue": -10
}

If you create a price element with the same condition type as existing, it will override the existing price element and will mark it inactive and make the new one active.  

 

Update item price element of an existing solution order item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement/100004251/10/240/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "BusinessSolutionOrder": "100004251",
  "BusinessSolutionOrderItem": "10",
  "PricingProcedureStep": "240",
  "PricingProcedureCounter": "1",
  "ConditionType": "DRV1",
  "ConditionRateValue": -5
}

The PricingProcedureStep and PricingProcedureCounter needs to be passed in the parameter

 

Delete an item price element of an existing solution order item 

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmPriceElement/100004251/10/240/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

To Deleting an item price element, PricingProcedureStep and PricingProcedureCounter needs to be passed in the parameter.

 

BusSolnOrdItmScheduleLine ‚Äì Item Schedule Line(Sales Item)

You can only read a schedule line entity and no other operations are supported on this entity, and this is only relevant for a sales item

 

Read a schedule line of a sales item of an existing solution order

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmScheduleLine/100004251/10/1

You can also use the $filter parameter to filter by the solution order you will get all the schedule line entities for the solution order

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmScheduleLine?$filter=BusinessSolutionOrder eq '100004251'

 

BSOrdItmRateElement ‚Äì Item Rate Element (Subscription Item)

You cannot update a rate element but can read an existing rate element for a solution order subscription item using BSOrdItmRateElement

 By passing the solution order number, item and rate element number. You can also read the rate element when you read a solution order item with an expand=_RateElement

 

BSOrdItmSubscrpnParameter ‚Äì Item Subscription Parameter(Subscription Item)

You can read a subscription parameter using a GET operation on the BSOrdItmSubscrpnParameter entity by passing the solution order number, item and the subscription parameter sequence number or by reading the solution order item with a $expand = _SubscriptionParameter

Update subscription parameter of an existing solution order item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BSOrdItmSubscrpnParameter/100004251/70/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc

IF-Match: *

{
  "SubscriptionParameter": "ONETIME_CREDIT",
  "SubscrpnParameterIntegerValue": 2
}

You can update a subscription parameter of a subscription item only if the item is not released or completed already

 

Delete subscription parameter of an existing solution order item

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BSOrdItmSubscrpnParameter/100004251/70/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

 

You can delete a subscription parameter of a subscription item only if the item is not released or completed already

 

Create subscription parameter of an existing solution order item

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/70/_SubscriptionParameter

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SubscriptionParameter": "ONETIME_CREDIT",
  "SubscrpnParameterIntegerValue": 1
}

You can create a subscription parameter of a subscription item using the POST operation on BusinessSolutionOrderItem using the association _SubscriptionParameter

 

 

BSOrdItmSubscrpnPriceAgrmt Item Price Agreement(Subscription Item)

Price agreements are originally persisted in the subscription system, however this can be customised in the S/4HANA system. In such cases, the customised values are additionally persisted in S/4HANA systems.

 

Update subscription price agreement of an existing solution order item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BSOrdItmSubscrpnPriceAgrmt(BusinessSolutionOrder='100004251',BusinessSolutionOrderItem='000070',SubscriptionRateElement='ONETIME_CRDT',SubscriptionRateSubElement='',SubscrpnBillgPrcElmntSpec='OneTimePrice',SubscrpnBillgPricingField='price',SubscrpnBillgPrcAgreementLine='900001')

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SubscrpnBillgPricingScaleType": "A",
  "SubscrpnBillgCndnCalcType": "B",
  "ConditionRateValue": 1001,
  "ConditionCurrency": "USD"
}

 

Delete subscription price agreement of an existing solution order item

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BSOrdItmSubscrpnPriceAgrmt(BusinessSolutionOrder='100004251',BusinessSolutionOrderItem='000070',SubscriptionRateElement='ONETIME_CRDT',SubscriptionRateSubElement='',SubscrpnBillgPrcElmntSpec='OneTimePrice',SubscrpnBillgPricingField='price',SubscrpnBillgPrcAgreementLine='900001')

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

You can update or delete a subscription price agreement of a subscription item only if the item is not released or completed already. To be sure you pass the mandatory information correctly, you can do a GET operation on the BSOrdItmSubscrpnPriceAgrmt entity for the subscription item you want to update the price Agreement. It is required to pass the scale type and calculation type in the payload even though you do not intend to modify them

BusSolnOrdItmProduct ‚Äì Item Product(Contract Item)

 

Update item product list of an existing solution order contract item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmProduct/100004251/100/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SrvcProductListProduct":"SRV_05"
}

 

Delete subscription price agreement of an existing solution order item

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmProduct/100004251/100/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

You can update or delete an Item Product List of contract item only if the item is not released or completed already.

 

BusSolnOrdItmRefObject ‚Äì Item Reference Object(Service or Contract Item)

 

Update item reference object list of an existing solution order contract item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmProduct/100004251/100/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SrvcProductListProduct":"SRV_05"
}

 

Delete item reference object list of an existing solution order contract item

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmRefObject/100004251/100/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

 

You can update an Item Reference object of a service item by passing the equipment id or the functional location id in the payload or that of a contract item by passing the reference product id or the equipment id or the functional location id in the payload.

 

BusSolnOrdItemRelationship ‚Äì Solution Order Item Relationship

 

Get all item relationships in a solution order

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItemRelationship?$filter=BusinessSolutionOrder eq '100004251'

 

Delete an item relationship of type 001 (Depends on) between item 10 and 20

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItemRelationship/100004251/10/001/20

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

 

BusSolnOrdUserStatus ‚Äì Header User Status

 

Create user status at header for an existing solution order

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/<<SOLO_ID>>/_UserStatus

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "BusinessSolutionOrder": "100004251",
  "UserStatus": "E0002"
}

 

Create user status at header using deep insert while creating a solution order

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "BusSolnOrdType": "SOLO",
  "BusSolnOrdDescription": "Solution Order with User Status",
  "Language": "EN",
  "SoldToParty": "17100001",
  "SalesOrganization": "1710",
  "DistributionChannel": "10",
  "Division": "00",
  "RespEmployeeBusinessPartnerId": "9980000549",
  "PurchaseOrderByCustomer": "External Reference",
  "_UserStatus": [
    {
      "UserStatus": "E0002"
    }
  ]
}

 

BusSolnOrdItmUserStatus ‚Äì Item User Status

Prerequisites: Make sure to assign the status profile to which the user status belongs to the respective item category of the solution order item. To do this, using SSCUI, define status profile for User Status and assign the status profile to item categories

Create item user status at item for an existing solution order

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100004251/10/_UserStatus

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "UserStatus": "E0002"
}

 

Create item user status using deep insert while creating a solution order item

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100004251/_Item

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "Product": "TG11",
  "Quantity": 1,
  "BusSolnOrdItmQtyUnitISOCode": "EA",
  "_UserStatus": [
    {
      "UserStatus": "E0002"
    }
  ]
}

 

BusinessSolutionOrderLongText ‚Äì Header Long Text

 

Get all header text of a solution order

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderLongText?$filter=BusinessSolutionOrder eq '100004251'

 

Get a specific header text of a solution order

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderLongText/100004251/0001/EN

 

Update a header text of a solution order

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderLongText/100004251/0001/EN

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "BusinessSolutionOrderLongText":"Updated Header Text"
}

 

Delete a header text of a solution order

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderLongText/100004251/0001/EN

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

 

BusSolnOrdItmLongTxt ‚Äì Item Long Text

 

Get item text of a solution order item 10

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmLongTxt?$filter=BusinessSolutionOrder eq '100004251'and BusinessSolutionOrderItem eq '10'

 

Update item text of a solution order item 10

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmLongTxt/100004251/10/001/EN

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "BusSolnOrdItmLongText": "Updated Item Text"
}

 

Delete item text of a solution order item 10

DELETE
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmLongTxt/100004251/10/001/EN

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

 

BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem ‚Äì Billing Request Item(of a Contract Item)

Only READ operation is supported on the BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem entity. This will be available only for service contract item with item category SOSC (Service Contract Item) and SOPA (Service Contract Price Adaptation)

 

Get all Billing Request Items of a solution order contract item

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem?$filter=BusinessSolutionOrder eq '100004251'

 

Get a specific billing request item of a solution order contract item by id

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem/100004251/100/800001

 

BSOrdItmBillgReqItmPrcElm ‚Äì Price element of Billing Request Item (Contract Item)

You can create a Price Element for a Billing request Item of a Contract item of a solution order using the _PriceElement association of the BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem entity.

 

Create a discount price element for a specific billing item a solution order service contract item

POST
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem/100004251/100/800001/_PriceElement

X-CSRF-Token: abc

{
  "ConditionType": "DRV1",
  "ConditionRateValue": -10,
  "ConditionCurrency": "USD"
}

Above payload will create a price element (Fixed Discount DRV1) for billing item 800001 of the service contract item

 

Read all the price element for a billing request item of a solution order contract item

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmBillgReqItem/100004251/100/800001/_PriceElement

 

Update a price element for a billing request item of a solution order contract item

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BSOrdItmBillgReqItmPrcElm/100004251/100/800001/90/1

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
   "ConditionType": "PSI1",
   "ConditionRateValue": 120
}

 

BusSolnOrdAppointment ‚Äì Header Appointment

Appointment entities are used to persist various date fields in solution order. 

You define the Appointment type using the configuration activity Define Date Types, Duration Types and Date Rules for Service Transactions in your configuration environment. The system uses the duration, dates types, and date rules that are combined in a specific date profile to display dates in a transaction and to automatically determine them. Make sure to assign the date profile to transaction types. 

 

Update BILL_DATE at solution order header using the Appointment Entity

Billing Date is a single date field and does not have a start and end date, in such case in the payload, the SrvcDocApptStartDateTime needs to be passed.

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdAppointment/100004251/BILL_DATE

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SrvcDocAppointmentType": "BILL_DATE",
  "SrvcDocApptStartDateTime": "2025-10-23T00:00:00Z",
}

 

Read BILL_DATE at solution order header using the Appointment Entity 

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdAppointment/100004251/BILL_DATE

BusSolnOrdItmAppointment ‚Äì Item Appointment

To update subscription end date of a subscription item, use the ServiceContrItemEndDateTime field at the BusinessSolutionOrderItem entity instead of the CONTEND Appointment type.

 

Update Requested delivery date of a sales item of a solution order using the Appointment Entity 

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmAppointment/100004251/10/REQ_DLV_DATE

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SrvcDocAppointmentType": "REQ_DLV_DATE",
  "SrvcDocApptStartDateTime": "2025-10-28T00:00:00Z"
}

 

BusSolnOrdItmDuration ‚Äì Item Duration

Various durations like subscription terms, contract duration, renewal terms, etc are stored as durations in the BusSolnOrdItmDuration entity which has an association with the BusinessSolutionOrderItem entity. The different duration types in solution order are persisted across the duration types specified in the below table.

You define the Duration type using the configuration activity Define Date Types, Duration Types and Date Rules for Service Transactions in your configuration environment. The system uses the duration, dates types, and date rules that are combined in a specific date profile to display dates in a transaction and to automatically determine them. Make sure to assign the date profile to transaction types. 

 

Update Contract Duration of a contract item of a solution order using the Duration Entity 

PATCH
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusSolnOrdItmDuration/100004251/100/CONTDURA

X-CSRF-Token: abc
IF-Match: *

{
  "SrvcDocDurationType": "CONTDURA",
  "SrvcDocDurationValue": 48,
  "SrvcDocDurationUnit": "Month"
}

 

BusSolnOrdFUPSalesOrder ‚Äì Follow-up Sales Order

You can only read the follow up sales order and no other operations are supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up sales order document for the solution order. Once a sales item is released, the follow up document gets created. This corresponds to the ‚ÄúTransaction History‚Äù section on the UI

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100003541/_FUPSalesOrder

 

BusSolnOrdFUPSrvcOrd ‚Äì Follow-up Service Order

You can only read the follow up service order and no other operations are supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up service order document for the solution order. Once a service item is released, the follow up document gets created. This corresponds to the ‚ÄúTransaction History‚Äù section on the UI

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100003541/_FUPServiceOrder

 

BusSolnOrdFUPSrvcContr ‚Äì Follow-up Service Contract

You can only read the follow up service contract and no other operations are supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up service contract document for the solution order. Once a service contract item is released, the follow up document gets created. This corresponds to the ‚ÄúTransaction History‚Äù section on the UI

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100003541/_FUPServiceContr

 

BusSolnOrdFUPSubscrpn ‚Äì Follow-up Subscription

You can only read the follow up subscription and no other operations are supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up subscription document for the solution order. Once a subscription item is released, the follow up document gets created. This corresponds to the ‚ÄúTransaction History‚Äù section on the UI

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100003541/_FUPSubscrpn

 

 

BusSolnOrdFUPEntProject ‚Äì Follow-up Enterprise Project

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up project document for the solution order. Once a project item is released, the follow up document gets created. This corresponds to the ‚ÄúTransaction History‚Äù section on the UI

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrder/100003541/_FUPEntProject

 

BusSolnOrdItmFUPSalesOrder - Follow-up Sales Order Item

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up sales order along with its corresponding item numbers. Once a sales item is released, the follow up document gets created.

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/10/_FUPSalesOrderItem

 

BusSolnOrdItmFUPSrvcOrd ‚Äì Follow-up Service Order Item

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up service order along with its corresponding item numbers. Once a sales item is released, the follow up document gets created.

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/20/_FUPServiceOrderItem

 

BusSolnOrdItmFUPSrvcContr ‚Äì Follow-up Service Contract Item

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up service contract along with its corresponding item numbers. Once a service contract item is released, the follow up document gets created.

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/30/_FUPServiceContrItem

 

BusSolnOrdItmFUPSubscrpn ‚Äì Follow-up Subscription Item

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up subscription. Once a subscription item is released, the follow up document gets created.

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/40/_FUPSubscrpnItem

 

BusSolnOrdItmFUPEntProject - Follow-up Enterprise Project Item

Only read operation is supported on this entity. This will list all the follow-up project document for the solution order. Once a service contract item is released, the follow up document gets created.

GET
<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_businesssolutionorder/srvd_a2x/sap/businesssolutionorder/0001
/BusinessSolutionOrderItem/100004251/50/_FUPEntProjectItem

entry.title: Discover what‚Äôs new in SAP Signavio‚Äôs major Process Landscape Analysis update this November
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-paced ERP transformation landscape, achieving process transparency, harmonization, and efficiency is critical. Organizations migrating to SAP S/4HANA face the challenge of aligning complex business processes across multiple units while ensuring adoption of standardized templates. SAP Signavio‚Äôs Process Landscape Analysis (PLA), as part of the plug and gain approach, addresses these challenges by providing a structured, data-driven way to manage and optimize processes throughout the transformation journey. All essentials and key resources regarding plug and gain approach can be found here.

The latest update of the PLA introduces new content, an improved user experience and a completely new dashboard, making process harmonization easier and more actionable than ever. 

In this blog, you will get a high-level overview of:

  • The latest updates to Process Landscape Analysis and its new structure
  • The new Adherence to Target Processes dashboard and its key insights

 

The Process Landscape Analysis

First: what's new in the update?

The latest major PLA update delivers more and deeper content and new capabilities to track harmonization and ensure process adherence. The image below gives a clear overview of the current version and everything that will be added new. 

 

Understanding the Process Landscape Analysis 

What does this mean? To give a bit more context, let‚Äôs dive a bit more into the process landscape analysis and how it is built up. At its core, Process Landscape Analysis offers a consolidated view of the processes running in an ERP system by combining several modules of the SAP Signavio Suite. Built on three key components, it allows organizations to understand current process performance, identify process variants, and monitor adherence to target processes:

  • The Process House ‚Äì Provides a top-down structure for navigating individual processes. It aggregates information at the end-to-end process level and company level, giving stakeholders a complete overview of process execution across the organization.
  • Individual Processes ‚Äì Each process is analyzed for execution, variants, and transaction code usage. The Best-Run Score (BRS) evaluates process effectiveness and efficiency, helping identify high-volume processes that may need optimization.
  • Adherence to Target Processes Analysis ‚Äì Compares actual execution with defined target process variants to monitor compliance, enforce standardization, and support the rollout of ERP templates.

Together, these three components create a comprehensive view of your ERP processes, laying the foundation for informed decisions and a successful transformation journey. The following video shows how it looks like. 

 

Adherence to Target Processes

A cornerstone of the update is the Adherence to Target Processes dashboard, which enables organizations to track harmonization and ensure process adherence in SAP transformation projects. The dashboard comes with the following analysis:

  • Current Process Variants Analysis ‚Äì Provides a snapshot of process variants used across organizational units, highlighting inconsistencies and opportunities for standardization.
  • Comparison Against Target Processes ‚Äì Measures adherence to defined templates, revealing deviations and guiding corrective actions, such as training or process refinement.
  • Assessment of Target Processes ‚Äì Identifies rarely or never used variants, enabling deprecation and maintaining a lean ERP template.

For instance, if a rollout introduces a new procurement process, the dashboard shows which units follow the target process, where deviations occur, and which legacy variants may require retirement, ensuring operational efficiency and governance.

 

Challenge: Ensuring Consistent Execution Across Organizational Units

When customers define a template for their ERP system, they typically specify multiple process variants for each process. In each ERP system, customers are running many processes. This is called the ERP-Template. With Plug and Gain Process Landscape Analysis, customers can measure the actual process execution across more than 100 processes right out of the box.

However, the typical questions customers then ask: 

To which extent does our actual process execution match with the ERP template? Where do we need to reinforce the rollout?

And it‚Äôs not enough to see this at a global level. Typical customers have > 1,000 combinations of processes and organizational units. We need the transparency by process and organizational unit. That‚Äôs where the new adherence to target processes dashboard comes in! Within the dashboard customers are able to define specific target process variants for each process (their ERP template) and measure actual execution against that on the level of process and organizational unit. This helps understand how far away from the template the current execution is, if the role out was successful and exactly where it was not. 

 

Why Process Harmonization Matters

Process harmonization is essential for consistent, efficient, and compliant operations across an organization. It ensures that business processes are executed uniformly to reduce complexity, improve quality, and drive measurable business outcomes.
Successful harmonization strengthens both the top line (better customer experience, better financial results, faster execution) and the bottom line (cost reduction, standardization, and compliance). Yet, many organizations struggle to achieve this consistency, especially when multiple systems, tools, and organizational units are involved.

 

SAP Learning Journey available

In addition, we offer the following SAP Learning Journey, which provides a comprehensive guide to Process Landscape Analysis, including detailed explanations of each analysis, supporting video tutorials and how it could be applied in SAP Activate..

entry.title: IntelliFlow Manufacturing with SAP S/4HANA UX and Collaboration Manager
entry.content:
*********************** Updated as per 2508 release *******************************

In the ever-changing field of digital manufacturing, SAP continues to push the boundaries of innovation with its new release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Among the noteworthy features is the Review Progress Order‚ÄîMultilevel View App, a game-changing tool for improving visibility, control, and cooperation across production and procurement processes. This strong pair, together with the newly released SAP Collaboration Manager, is redefining real-time communication and job execution for industrial teams.

Introducing the Review Progress Order app.
Manufacturing procedures are complicated, with many levels of connections, components, and timelines. The Review Progress Order App handles this complexity by providing a multi-level view of production, sales, and processing orders.

It allows users to

  •   Visualize component needs and receipt aspects throughout an order structure.
    ‚Ä¢ Identify and analyze component shortages and delays to determine their root causes.
    ‚Ä¢ Calculate total order delays depending on delivery and production time.
    ‚Ä¢ Easily access associated apps, such as Manage Material Coverage, Display Material Stock, and Change Planned Order.
    ‚Ä¢ Export data to Excel for offline analysis and reporting.

Why It Matters
Manufacturers frequently suffer with fragmented data and delayed insights. The Review Progress Order App combines crucial information into a single, simple interface. It enables planners and production managers to make educated decisions more rapidly, minimizing bottlenecks and boosting on-time delivery performance.
Collaboration Manager: A New Era of In-App Communication.
SAP has officially decommissioned the SAP CoPilot and introduced the SAP Collaboration Manager as a replacement for human-to-human collaboration within the SAP Fiori Launchpad. This innovation is currently available in both SAP S/4HANA Cloud and on-premise editions, providing a contextual, real-time communication layer directly within business applications

Key Features of Collaboration Manager:
‚Ä¢ Set up individual or group discussions based on specific screens or business objects.
‚Ä¢ Include attachments, screenshots, and video links in chats.
‚Ä¢ Edit or remove messages quickly after posting.
‚Ä¢ Convert private notes into collaborative threads as needed.
‚Ä¢ Go straight to the screenshot or chat screen.
‚Ä¢ Receive quick notifications for prompt answers and task completion
Collaboration in the Manufacturing Context

Let's see a demo to understand it more clearly. 

To set the context, let's assume a sales representative has received a call from a customer about the delay of their order. The sales representative then contacts the production team to inquire about the delay.  Assume a production planner uses the Review Progress Order App to detect a delay in a vital component. Rather than switching systems or exchanging emails, users may start a discussion with the procurement team right away using Collaboration Manager. The discussion contains screenshots, order information, and direct links to the affected components. This in-house collaboration eliminates delays, improves clarity, and speeds up problem solving.

Here in the demo, one of the customers contacted the sales representative, Dale Jones, who was asking for confirmation on the delayed sales order delivery. The sales representative sent a message through Collaboration Manager to the material planner or production planner regarding this matter. Here, the material planner, Michelle, replied with "acknowledge the message" by clicking on the sent icon to the sales representative through the Collaboration Manager.


Fig 1 : In App communication - Collaboration Manager

 

Fig 2 : Collaboration Manager - Acknowledgement

Then Michelle clicks on the "Review Order Progress" app in the Favorites section. After providing the sales order number in the app, she finds the Issues column and finds two issues are present‚Äîone of the required components has an uncovered quantity of 3 pieces for a planned product order. In this case, ‚ÄúPldOrd 4000002986.‚Äù The other one has a total delay of 1 day for the 10 pieces coming via a purchase requisition. In this case, ‚ÄúPurRqs 3000002513-10.‚Äù

Fig 3 : Review Progress Order app

 

Fig 4: in app option to navigate

The app, "Manage Material Coverage" option‚ÄîManage the material coverage to resolve this issue. The "Reschedule" option for the Purchase Requisition provides a summary of the material coverage for this component, indicating that we are short by 10 pieces and need them within 9 days. The stock/requirements list provides an overview of what is coming in and going out when: Aug 12th I need 10 pieces, but I will be 10 short then.


Fig 5: Resolving issue

The system automatically proposes the new delivery date. It is now up to the user to accept it or reject it for an earlier or later date.

Fig 6 : Issue shown

Here, the coverage issue for the material can be viewed.

Fig 7: In house navigation

 

Fig 8: Resolving issue via Manage Monitor Coverage

 

Fig 9: Issue Resolve

All the issues are now resolved.
The Review Order Progress application makes it easy to obtain an overview of any issues an order may have and also makes it easy to resolve them.

Fig 10: Collaboration Manager - communication

 

Customer Benefits: Synergy of UX and Intelligence
The combination of the Review Progress Order App and Collaboration Manager provides a comprehensive user experience that combines data transparency and real-time collaboration. This is how customers benefit:
1. Improved Decision-Making
With multilayer visibility of order progress and component delays, users can solve issues before they escalate. The ability to export data and navigate to connected apps ensures that decisions are based on thorough information.
2. Improved operational efficiency.
Collaboration Manager improves workflow efficiency by eliminating the need for external communication tools and enabling contextual discussions. Teams spend less time searching for information and more time carrying out tasks.
3. Faster issue resolution.
Real-time notifications and interactive threads help cross-functional teams address problems rapidly. The system immediately notifies the appropriate persons of any shortage, delay, or procurement problem.
4. User-Centric Design.
Both tools are based on SAP Fiori, which ensures a uniform and straightforward user experience. The interface is dynamic, role-based, and geared for productivity, whether used on a desktop or a mobile device.
5. Scalability & Integration
These elements are part of SAP's overall vision for building an intelligent, sustainable organization. They readily interact with other SAP apps and modules, allowing for scalability across sectors and geographies.

Conclusion: A New Standard for Manufacturing Excellence.
SAP's most recent developments in S/4HANA are more than just feature enhancements; they represent a paradigm shift in how industrial firms function. The Review Progress Order App clarifies complex order structures, and the Collaboration Manager encourages agile, informed teamwork.
They represent a strong blend of UX and enterprise intelligence, allowing businesses to respond faster, collaborate smarter, and provide better results. For consumers, their use implies more production, lower costs, and higher satisfaction‚Äîall hallmarks of a really intelligent manufacturing organization.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments ‚Äì Transition and Future with APIs
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Customer Payments - Transition and Future with APIs

SAP has transitioned SAP Cloud for Customer Payments into maintenance mode and removed it from the price list (as of September 2, 2024). The solution will continue to be supported for existing customers under active contracts, but no further development or investments are made. Customers are encouraged to transition to the new API-based approach in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and On-Premise/Private Cloud.

Accounts receivable processes today are often costly, manual, and time-consuming. Many businesses face delays in cash collection, lack of transparency for their customers, and high operational costs for invoice and payment handling.

With the new S/4HANA APIs, SAP enables customers and partners to build modern customer-facing portals that accelerate the invoice-to-cash process and support automated cash collection. These portals empower end customers with self-service capabilities, reducing manual workload while improving the customer experience.

Capabilities Enabled by S/4HANA APIs

Using the APIs already available in S/4HANA On-Premise, Private Cloud, and Public Cloud businesses can:

APIs for Electronic Bill Presentment and Payment

  • Pay & manage bills: Select open items, create payments (via direct debit or credit card when SAP Digital Payments Add-on is integrated), view or cancel payments in process
  • Display account statements: View and download all items for a specific time period for the customer invoice, credit memo, and / or incoming payment(s)

Other APIs

  • Match payments with invoices: Improve reconciliation through payment matching
  • Create and manage payment advice: Issue or cancel payment advice efficiently
  • Make ad-hoc payments: Support payments on account or down payment requests
  • Manage account master data: View and update account and master data directly

These capabilities can be embedded into custom-built portals or integrated into existing customer-facing portals, offering flexibility for each company‚Äôs unique landscape.

This new API approach is not a one-to-one successor, but provides greater flexibility:

  • APIs are released for S/4HANA On-Premise, Private Cloud, and Public Cloud (from release 2508.02)
  • Customers can build their own portals, integrate into existing ones, or leverage partner-built portals
  • Partners are actively working with SAP to deliver ready-to-use solutions based on these APIs

Partner Solutions: Ready-to-Use Customer Payment Portals

To help customers accelerate adoption, SAP partners already offer pre-built customer payment and self-service portals leveraging the new APIs.

Kumulon ‚Äì KUMOsphere B2B Payment Portal

Kumulon delivers a cloud-native, template-based portal built on SAP BTP with full support for SAP‚Äôs latest payment APIs.

  • Real cloud services, no legacy code ‚Äì innovative SAP Cloud technologies only
  • Flexible templates ‚Äì adapt quickly to customer needs while jumpstarting projects
  • Secure integration ‚Äì SAP Cloud Connector ensures safe on-premise-to-cloud connectivity
  • Flexible deployment ‚Äì operate in your own BTP environment or as SaaS on Kumulon‚Äôs BTP

üîó KUMOsphere ‚Äì B2B Payment Portal on SAP Store

Acuiti Labs ‚Äì Customer Self Care and Payment Portal

Acuiti Labs offers a SaaS-based self-service and payment portal for S/4HANA Private and Public Cloud (Sales Billing/FI-AR) leveraging the S/4HANA APIs.

  • Customer self-service portal ‚Äì empowers end customers to manage invoices and payments directly
  • Cross-solution experience ‚Äì already proven in BRIM (FI-CA), Subscription Billing, and Q2C portals
  • Accelerated go-live ‚Äì prebuilt solution reduces implementation effort

üîó Acuiti Labs Customer Portal on SAP Store

Learn More

APIs for Electronic Billing and Presentment ‚Äì S/4HANA On-Premise (OP), Private Cloud

  • All APIs part of the Electronic Billing and Presentment scope are shipped via SAP Note 3505741
  • For other required APIs outside the package, please see also the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for more details, for example: Managing Payment Advice is available, see Payment Advice (A2X).
  • For more information, visit the SAP Help Portal.

APIs for EBPP Payment Request ‚Äì S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Please see the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for the available EBPP Payment Request APIs.
  • For other required APIs outside the package, please see also the SAP Business Accelerator Hub for more details, for example:
    • Match payments with invoices & Create and manage payment advice, Payment Advice.
    • Make ad-hoc payments, Journal Entry -Post
    • Manage account master data, Business Partner
    • Customer account balance, Accounting Document - Read
  • For more information, visit the SAP Help Portal.

Summary

SAP Cloud for Customer Payments is moving into maintenance mode, and the future lies in API-driven, flexible customer payment portals. Customers can now:

  • Plan their transition to S/4HANA API-based solutions
  • Either build their own portals or leverage ready-to-use partner solutions from the SAP Store

This shift gives businesses greater flexibility, faster innovation, and improved customer experiences in the accounts receivable process.

entry.title: Bridging Project Planning: Integrating SAP Cloud ERP with SAP Project and Resource Management (PRM)
entry.content:
As project-driven organizations increasingly adopt SAP Cloud ERP , the need for robust project planning capabilities becomes critical. While SAP Cloud ERP excels in financial, commercial and logistics aspects of project management, SAP Project and Resource Management (PRM) complements the SAP Business Suite‚Äîoffering scheduling, resource allocation, and project structure capabilities.

This blog provides details on integration relevant features that enables intelligent project execution by importing projects from SAP Cloud ERP into PRM and then proceed with further detailed project planning and scheduling. 

Integration Setup

PRM supports integration with Enterprise Projects as well as Professional Service Projects. There are two ways to integrate with SAP Cloud ERP for the purpose of project planning, execution and scheduling.

  1. Use the recommended approach i.e. Direct Point-Point Integration.
  2. Alternatively, you can establish the integration using SAP Integration Suite.

For organizations evaluating integration options between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Project and Resource Management (PRM), it's important to understand the advantages of each approach and why the direct point-to-point integration is recommended.

Direct Point-to-Point Integration offers seamless synchronization of project data using the Enterprise Project API. This method ensures that project information is always up-to-date between SAP Cloud ERP and PRM, reducing manual data entry and the risk of errors. It supports both enterprise and professional services projects and enables full project management capabilities within PRM, including editing and scheduling of imported project plans. Customers benefit from a streamlined process, improved data accuracy, and the ability to leverage advanced planning  and scheduling features offered by PRM, making it ideal for organizations seeking an integrated and efficient project management workflow.

Integration via SAP Integration Suite provides flexibility for more complex or hybrid system landscapes, especially when connecting to SAP Cloud ERP Private. While this approach may suit organizations with specific middleware or integration requirements, it currently supports only the import of project plans through the ‚ÄúManage Multiple Project Plans‚Äù application. This means that imported plans cannot be edited or scheduled within PRM, potentially limiting the depth of project management and planning capabilities available to users.

In summary, customers using SAP Cloud ERP should choose the recommended direct point-to-point integration because it delivers comprehensive project management functions, enables bi-directional data exchange, and ensures optimal use of PRM‚Äôs planning and scheduling tools. The SAP Integration Suite option may be considered for specialized cases but comes with functional limitations that may impact project execution and flexibility.

Detailed Overview 

This section offers a step-by-step walkthrough of the key features that enable project plan integration between SAP Project and Resource Management (PRM) and SAP Cloud ERP, accessible via the ‚ÄúManage Project Plans‚Äù application.

Pre-requisite:

  • You have created either an Enterprise Project with a high level project plan or a PSA Project with few work packages added to it, in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • You have created a Collaborative Project in PRM which we would use further in this blog.

 The next step is to import the Enterprise or PSA Project in SAP Cloud ERP as a project plan within the Collaborative Project in PRM

In ‚ÄúManage Project Plans‚Äù application, start creating a project plan for your Collaborative Project by choosing the option ‚Äú From Other System‚Äù.

In the pop-up window, the Collaborative Project gets defaulted from the previous selection. The ‚ÄúSource System‚Äù field should be showing already the SAP Cloud ERP system that‚Äôs configured as active in Business System Configuration application. In case of multiple SAP Cloud ERP systems configured in PRM as active, you can select the one from the drop down list from which you want to import the project.

By default, the ‚ÄúRelated Object‚Äù(Created in Collaborative Project) checkbox field is selected. When you click on ‚ÄúGo‚Äù, the system shows a list of projects based on the Related Objects of object type ‚ÄúProject‚Äù that you would have created earlier for the collaborative project as shown in the ‚ÄúRelated Objects‚Äù screenshot below. This allows you to quickly choose a project from the list without searching for it and proceed with project plan creation

If there are no Related Objects created prior to this step, then you can deselect the ‚ÄúRelated Object‚Äù(Created in Collaborative Project) checkbox and start to search the projects by choosing the value help provided for ‚ÄúProject from Source System‚Äù. You can type in a search term which can either be the project ID or Name . Select a project and click on ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù

Hint : While searching projects, the system uses ‚ÄúEnterprise Project‚Äù API to communicate with the corresponding source SAP Cloud ERP system and hence the list would show both Professional Services projects as well as Enterprise Projects.

In the next screen, system shows a preview of things that will be done by the system. Choose ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù to finish importing the project as a project plan in PRM.

You can see that the project structure(Work Packages and Milestones) from the source system has been imported along with the scheduling relevant information like Planned Start , Planned Finish dates . The duration field shows the calculated number of days between the start and finish dates.

Navigation links to Source System

If the project that you imported is an Enterprise Project, you can navigate to the corresponding Project Briefs app or the WBS Element by clicking on the hyperlink provided for each element in the project structure

If the project that you imported is a Professional Services Project, the project structure would contain the relevant Work Packages and Billing Elements. You can navigate to the corresponding project in the ‚ÄúProject Control- Professional Services Projects‚Äù application by clicking on relevant hyperlinks in the project structure.

Keeping PRM and SAP Cloud ERP Projects in Sync

When you Edit Project Plan in the Manage Project Plans app, the system first validates whether any incremental changes have been made to the corresponding source project in the SAP Cloud ERP system by any user. If such updates exist, the user is prompted to Receive Updates before proceeding, ensuring that the version being edited reflects the latest data from the source project.

The Sync Actions button in the Manage Project Plans app provides three key options that control how schedule data is exchanged between systems.

  • Receive Updates ‚Äì pulls the latest project structure information from the source project in SAP Cloud ERP into PRM, ensuring that the project plan in PRM reflects the most current version.
  • Send Updates ‚Äì pushes date changes made in PRM. Ideally this is not needed to be used until there are some error situations in date synchronization, in which case the user will be shown the messages in the project plan application.
  • Check Send Status ‚Äì allows project managers to verify the transmission results and monitor whether the synchronization of dates has been successfully completed. In case of error situations, error message is shown in the project plan header of this application. For more details on this, refer this troubleshooting section in PRM user guide.

Now let‚Äôs do some edits to the project plan. Change Project Plan start  date. Add some dependencies between the work packages or milestones by establishing Finish-Start Relationships.

Change project plan settings to scheduling to ‚ÄúForward Scheduling‚Äù for example. And then click on ‚ÄúSchedule‚Äù to schedule the project with forward scheduling settings. The dates must have changed for some of the project elements. Once editing is complete and the project plan is saved, any changes made to project plan header or any Work Package (Planned Start, Planned Finish, Actual Start, and Actual Finish dates) or any Milestone(Planned Finish, Actual Finish, and Forecast Finish dates) , either manually or through the Schedule function‚Äîare automatically synchronized back to the source project in SAP Cloud ERP.

You can click on ‚ÄúSync Actions‚Äù->‚ÄùCheck Send Status‚Äù to verify that the project plan is synchronized with source system. System should show a toast message as shown in screenshot below.

You can verify that the changes are reflected in SAP Cloud ERP system in ‚ÄúProject Planning‚Äù application as shown above.

This bi-directional synchronization ensures that both systems remain aligned, supporting consistent and accurate project scheduling across platforms.

Processing Status

In the Manage Project Plans app, the ability to edit project element dates depends on the processing status of the corresponding project in SAP Cloud ERP. You can notice that the processing status from the source project is also brought into the project plan and is shown both in the Project Plan Header and also at the Work package or Milestone level in the project structure. You can modify planned, actual, and forecast dates for both Enterprise Projects and Professional Services Projectswhen the project or the work package has processing status such as Created, Released, Partially Released, In Planning, In Contract Preparation, or In Execution. However, once a project reaches a Completed, Closed, or Locked status, editing of the work package or the milestone under it is no longer allowed.

Conclusion :

By integrating PRM with SAP Cloud ERP, customers can now achieve a truly unified project management experience that enables seamless coordination between planning and execution. This integration facilitates close monitoring of project timelines and milestones, while also providing precise control over project costs and material demands directly within the connected ERP system. As a result, organizations benefit from enhanced visibility, improved resource allocation, and the ability to respond swiftly to changes, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget. The synchronized data flow between platforms not only reduces manual effort but also supports informed decision-making, ultimately driving operational efficiency and better business outcomes.

Related API:

Project Plan Service API - to import project from SAP Cloud ERP into PRM:  
For detailed information, refer to the Business Accelerator Hub. 

Related Topics:  

  • Must Start On & Must Finish On Constraints: Define specific constraints on project elements, offering more precise control over scheduling and enhancing project flexibility. - To learn more, see this link: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/date-constraints-in-sap-... 
  • Schedule Projects with SAP Project and Resource Management : To learn more, see this link https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/schedule-projects-with-sap-project-and-resource-management/ba-p/14137576?emcs_t=S2h8ZW1haWx8a3Vkb3N8TUY4MjBUNEZERk9LQkR8MTQxMzc1NzZ8S1VET1N8aEs

Discover more by checking out our website.

entry.title: SAP EHS Public Cloud: Extending Your Existing Landscape Side-by-Side - A Deloitte Guidebook (Part 1)
entry.content:
Integrating SAP EHS Public Cloud: Extending Your Existing Landscape Side-by-Side - A Deloitte Guidebook

Part 1: Introduction & Overview

Table of Contents:

  • 1. Introduction: SAP EHS in the Public Cloud
  • 1.1 Deloitte's Objective & Approach
  • 1.2 What can you expect from this Blog Series?
  • 1.3 Why SAP Environment, Health & Safety (EHS) Matters?

  • 2. Integrating SAP EHS Public Cloud Side-by-Side (Guidebook)
  • 2.1 Scope
  • 2.1.1 Incident Management
  • 2.1.2 Risk Management
  • 2.1.3 Emissions Management

  • 2.2 System Landscape

  • 2.2.2 Architectural Approach

  • 2.3.2 Organizational & Functional Prerequisites
